concise_definition: v. 保持, 留下, 残留; n. 遗迹, 残余

definitions.explanation_en: To continue to exist in the same state or place, without changing or leaving; to stay behind after others have gone or after a change has occurred.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指保持在原状或原地，不发生改变或不离开；在他人离去或变化发生后仍留下来。
definitions.example_en: Despite the storm, the ancient temple remains standing.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管经历了风暴，这座古庙依然屹立不倒。

definitions.explanation_en: To be left over after a process, event, or consumption; to persist as a residue or remainder.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某个过程、事件或消耗之后仍遗留下来的部分；作为残余物持续存在。
definitions.example_en: Only a few crumbs remained on the plate after the meal.
definitions.example_cn: 饭后盘子里只留下了几点面包屑。

definitions.explanation_en: A surviving part or trace of something that has been destroyed, decayed, or disappeared; often used in archaeological or biological contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指已被摧毁、腐烂或消失之物所遗留下来的部分或痕迹，常用于考古学或生物学语境中。
definitions.example_en: Archaeologists uncovered the remains of a Roman villa beneath the modern city.
definitions.example_cn: 考古学家在现代城市下方发现了罗马别墅的遗迹。

comparison.analysis: “Stay” (停留) 更强调物理位置上的不移动，常用于短期或临时性的停留，语气较口语化。而 “remain” 更侧重于状态的持续性，可指抽象状态（如情绪、条件）的不变，语义更正式、更广泛。
“Continue” (继续) 强调动作或过程的延续，通常用于行为、活动或事件的持续进行。而 “remain” 强调的是状态的静止不变，不涉及动作的延续。例如：He continued talking（他继续说话）vs. He remained silent（他保持沉默）。
“Leave” (留下) 作为动词时，强调主动的“使某物留在某地”，主语通常是施动者。而 “remain” 是不及物动词，强调主语自身“留下来”，不涉及主动行为。例如：I left my book on the table（我主动把书留在桌上）vs. My book remained on the table（书自己留在那里，不强调谁做的）。
